partintro.para: Designing an OpenStack cloud is a great achievement. It requires a robust understanding of the requirements and needs of the cloud's users to determine the best possible configuration to meet them. OpenStack provides a great deal of flexibility to achieve your needs, and this part of the book aims to shine light on many of the decisions you need to make during the process.

To design, deploy, and configure OpenStack, administrators must understand the logical architecture. A diagram can help you envision all the integrated services within OpenStack and how they interact with each other. modules, types of
